alert.note: Alert for New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:35PM EST until January 12 at 1:20AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Minor severity for the following rivers in Connecticut... Yantic River near Yantic affecting New London County. For the Yantic River...including Yantic...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Yantic River near Yantic. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Flooding begins at several commercial structures along west Town Street in Yantic Flats. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:16 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:16 PM EST Wednesday was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 10/14/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Yantic River Yantic 9.0 9.4 Wed 10 pm ES 5.2 4.3 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EST.
